chargeHist.descr: Repeated Sexual Assault of Same Child (At Least 3 Violations of 1st Degree Sexual Assault)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Nathan T. Schloneger was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Repeated Sexual Assault of Same Child (At Least 3 Violations of 1st Degree Sexual Assault) [Modifiers: Repeater, Lifetime Supervision of Serious Sex Offenders], a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.025(1)(d).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Lifetime Supervision unless application is made to the Court by DOC.

superMiscConds.notes:
No contact with N.B.
No unsupervised contact with anyone under the age of 18 (while incarcerated he may have contact with his children with another adult present. Contact while on E.S. per his supervising agent).
Defendant not to consume/possess any alcohol or go into any taverns, bars, establishment/place where alcohol primarily is served/sold.
Defendant not to consume/use/possess any illegal substances/street drugs/non-prescribed drugs or drug paraphernalia.

Sex Offender Assessment and follow through with recommended programming.
Comply with Sex Offender Registry for Life.
Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge.
Any conditions, assessments and programming per agent.
AODA and follow through with recommended programming.

supervisions.notes: If Probation or Extended Supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

IT IS ORDERED that the judgment is summarily affirmed. See WIS STAT RULE 809.21
IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that Attorney Chris Gramstrup is relieved from further representing Nathan T. Schloneger in this appeal.  See WIS STAT RULE 809.32(3).
IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that this summary disposition order will not be published. 
(order dated October 15, 2019) *certified*
